caption.title: GADD34 (Ppp1r15a) mRNA expression after CHIKV infection and dsRNA treatment.
caption.p: A major consequence of the UPR and responses to dsRNA (via PKR [ 110]) is translation inhibition, which appears to promote anti-viral responses via reduced translation of inhibitors (e.g. A20, SHIP-1, IкBα) [ 94]. GADD34-mediated relief of translational repression (via eIF2α dephosphorylation and/or stress granule dissolution) is required for IFNβ protein synthesis [ 94, 95]. (A) GADD34 mRNA is up-regulated in feet and lymph nodes 2 days post CHIKV infection (using the RNA-Seq data set described in Wilson et al 2017); a result consistent with [ 95]. (B) Although GADD34 mRNA was also up-regulated in feet at 12 h after poly(I:C)/JetPEI injection, there were no significant differences for mice housed at 30°C.
